snippet: Across the country, mostly peaceful expressions of anger, including periods of silence and staged “die-ins,” continued over a Missouri grand jury’s conclusion.
abstract: Protests continue nationwide over grand jury's decision not to indict white police officer Darren Wilson for fatally shooting unarmed black teenager Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo; most of gatherings are peaceful.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY, JOHN ELIGON and JESS BIDGOOD
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from St. Louis; John Eligon from Ferguson, Mo.; and Jess Bidgood from Cambridge, Mass. Colin Moynihan contributed reporting from New York, Ann Hinga Klein from Iowa City, and Brandon Shaw from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Across the country, mostly peaceful expressions of anger, including periods of silence and staged “die-ins,” continued over a Missouri grand jury’s conclusion.

headline.main: A Week Later, Protesters Remain Vocal on Ferguson, Partly With Silence
headline.print_headline: A Week Later, Protesters Remain Vocal on Ferguson, Partly With Silence

keywords.value: Houston, Charles Hamilton, Institute for Race and Justice
keywords.name: organizations
